retail.name: In-bound & last-mile freight, DC/store replenishment
retail.description: Logistics is the single-largest controllable cost driver for omnichannel and grocery formats.

retail.name: Electricity, gas & HVAC
retail.description: Energy is the 4th-largest store OPEX line; every 1% saved lifts profit an equivalent 10-20% of new sales.

retail.name: Store, e-commerce & analytics IT
retail.description: POS upgrades, e-commerce platforms and data analytics dominate current capex.

retail.name: Voice & data connectivity
retail.description: High‐uptime links for price/stock sync and payment authorisations.

retail.name: Store & distribution-centre cleaning
retail.description: Cleanliness drives conversion and brand perception, especially in food retail.

retail.name: Cardboard, food & general waste services
retail.description: Rising landfill fees and ESG targets keep this firmly on the cost agenda.

retail.name: Property, liability & product-recall cover
retail.description: Large real-estate footprint and customer traffic elevate risk premiums.

retail.name: Merchant fees & cash-handling
retail.description: Card-present and on-line transactions drive unavoidable fee spend.

retail.name: Consumables & break-room stock
retail.description: Per-employee supply costs trend $75–$90 per month in <5-employee stores.

retail.name: Instore signage, shelf-talkers & ad flyers
retail.description: Still required for weekly promotions despite digital shift.

manufacturing.name: Electricity, natural-gas & process steam
manufacturing.description: Energy is the main variable cost outside raw materials, esp. in energy-intensive lines.

manufacturing.name: Plant maintenance & MRO parts
manufacturing.description: World-class plants target ≤5% of sales; reactive sites run 10%+.

manufacturing.name: In-bound raw-material & outbound finished-goods transport
manufacturing.description: Network optimisation projects often yield 5-10% cost savings.

manufacturing.name: OT/IT, MES, ERP
manufacturing.description: Digital twins, predictive maintenance and ERP upgrades dominate 2025 spend.

manufacturing.name: Scrap, hazardous & packaging waste
manufacturing.description: Zero-waste and circular-economy mandates driving investment.

manufacturing.name: Property, product liability & business-interruption
manufacturing.description: High machinery values and single-site dependency keep premiums elevated.

manufacturing.name: Diesel & alternative fuels for internal fleets
manufacturing.description: Volatile energy markets push hedging and dual-fuel strategies.

manufacturing.name: Engineering, EH&S, audit & consulting
manufacturing.description: Regulatory compliance and ESG reporting lift advisory spend.

manufacturing.name: Shop-floor & admin consumables
manufacturing.description: Lean initiatives target 10-15% reduction via point-of-use cabinets.

technology.name: Salaries, bonuses & benefits
technology.description: Human capital is the primary value driver; equity comp excluded.

technology.name: Internal IT & dev-tool stack
technology.description: Cloud IaaS, security and AI accelerators rising fastest.

technology.name: External IaaS/PaaS spend
technology.description: Gross-margin-sensitive line item; FinOps focus growing.

technology.name: Demand-gen & brand
technology.description: SaaS scale-ups routinely exceed 30% during high-growth phases.

technology.name: WAN, conference & mobile
technology.description: Hybrid work keeps UCaaS volumes high.

technology.name: Legal, audit & advisory
technology.description: IPO-track firms spend more on SOX readiness.

technology.name: Sales & customer success travel
technology.description: Post-pandemic rebound but still 30% below 2019 levels.

technology.name: Consumables & swag
technology.description: Remote-first policies trimmed HQ supply budgets.

technology.name: Office & data-centre power
technology.description: Green PPA adoption growing for Scope-2 goals.

healthcare.name: Electricity, steam & medical gases
healthcare.description: 5% energy-saving lifts non-profit margins by one full point.

healthcare.name: EHR, cybersecurity & digital front door
healthcare.description: EHR upgrades + cybersecurity now >50% of new-IT budget.

healthcare.name: Environmental & terminal cleaning
healthcare.description: Direct infection-control KPI; labor inflation hitting budgets.

healthcare.name: Regulated medical & pharma waste
healthcare.description: Strict compliance; volumes up with single-use PPE.

healthcare.name: Malpractice & property/casualty
healthcare.description: Liability caps vary by state; premiums accelerating 8-10% p.a.

healthcare.name: Network, paging & telehealth bandwidth
healthcare.description: Tele-ICU and remote imaging driving back-haul upgrades.

healthcare.name: Medical/surgical supplies distribution
healthcare.description: Cold-chain and JIT replenishment critical for high-value drugs.

healthcare.name: Clinical & admin consumables
healthcare.description: Digitisation trimming paper charts but PPE drives up disposables.

financial-services.name: Core banking, cloud & cybersecurity
financial-services.description: Banks lead all industries in IT intensity; Gen-AI pilots expanding spend.

financial-services.name: D&O, cyber & fidelity bonds
financial-services.description: Regulatory capital requirements keep coverage high.

financial-services.name: Advisory, audit, compliance
financial-services.description: SOX, Basel & ESG assurance drive consulting outlays.

financial-services.name: Data-centre & branch energy
financial-services.description: PUE improvements offset rising compute load.

financial-services.name: Brand, performance & CX campaigns
financial-services.description: Digital-only banks spend at upper end to acquire customers.

financial-services.name: Network & market-data feeds
financial-services.description: Low-latency circuits critical for trading desks.

financial-services.name: Cash-handling & admin consumables
financial-services.description: Cheque stock and secure print remain legacy spends.

construction.name: Steel, lumber, concrete, finishes
construction.description: Materials are >60% of residential build cost; tariffs inflate >20%.

construction.name: Skilled & unskilled craft labor
construction.description: Tight labor market adds wage-pressure >6% CAGR.

construction.name: Earth-moving & access equipment
construction.description: Rental avoids large capex; utilisation KPI is dollar-utilisation.

construction.name: Diesel & propane for equipment
construction.description: Fuel hedging critical; biodiesel adoption rising.

construction.name: Builders-risk, GL & workers comp
construction.description: Premiums track project value and EMR safety scores.

construction.name: C&D debris hauling & tipping
construction.description: LEED credits driving on-site sorting & recycling.

construction.name: BIM, project-management SaaS
construction.description: Cloud BIM & reality capture key to cost-control.

construction.name: Survey, design & legal
construction.description: Often re-billable but must be cash-flowed first.

professional-services.name: Salaries & partner draws
professional-services.description: Talent is inventory; utilisation drives margin.

professional-services.name: Office leases & coworking
professional-services.description: Prime CBD locations still command premium rents.

professional-services.name: Laptops, SaaS & cyber
professional-services.description: Knowledge-work runs on cloud productivity suites.

professional-services.name: Client travel & lodging
professional-services.description: Hybrid delivery reduced but not eliminated travel.

professional-services.name: Subcontracted experts & referral fees
professional-services.description: Used for niche deliverables outside core expertise.

professional-services.name: Office electricity & HVAC
professional-services.description: Green-lease clauses tie rent escalators to efficiency.

energy.name: Asset integrity & shutdowns
energy.description: Unplanned downtime costs $1 m+/day on offshore rigs.

energy.name: OT/SCADA, cyber & AI subsurface
energy.description: Digital twins and AI seismic interpretation expand IT share.

energy.name: Diesel & fleet fuels
energy.description: Drilling rigs & service fleets are fuel-intensive.

energy.name: Purchased power for midstream & refining
energy.description: Grid fees rise with electrification of pumps.

energy.name: Pipe, equipment & fuel hauling
energy.description: Rig-move cost spikes with oil-price volatility.

energy.name: Produced-water & hazardous waste
energy.description: Strict disposal regs; water-recycling capex rising.

telecommunications.name: Access & core network equipment
telecommunications.description: Fibre and 5G rollout dominate capex-to-revenue ratios.

telecommunications.name: Customer acquisition & retention
telecommunications.description: High churn rates keep media spend elevated.

telecommunications.name: Tower & data-centre power
telecommunications.description: Energy-per-bit reduction is key ESG metric.

telecommunications.name: Equipment distribution & reverse logistics
telecommunications.description: CPE swap-outs for technology refresh programmes.

telecommunications.name: Exchange & office facilities
telecommunications.description: Raised-floor dust control critical for data centres.

transportation.name: Diesel, jet & marine fuel
transportation.description: Fuel is the dominant variable cost; hedging and route-optimisation critical.

transportation.name: Auto, cargo & liability
transportation.description: Nuclear verdicts pushing premiums up 10-15 % p.a.

transportation.name: 3PL subcontract & drayage
transportation.description: Non-asset brokers rely heavily on purchased freight.

transportation.name: Warehouse & truck-wash services
transportation.description: Food-grade & pharma facilities must meet FSMA/GDP.

transportation.name: Pallet, dunnage & packaging recycling
transportation.description: Closed-loop pallet pools save 20% vs. one-way.
